text.0: graciously listen to our songs maghavan be not negligent.
text.1: as thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
text.2: well have they eaten and rejoiced the friends have risen and passed away.
text.3: the sages luminous in themselves have praised thee with their latest hymn now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
text.4: maghavan we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon.
text.5: thus praised according to our wish come now with richly laden car now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
text.6: he will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine.
text.7: who thinks upon the wellfilled bowl the tawny coursers harnesser now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
text.8: let lord of hundred powers thy steeds be harnessed on the right and left.
text.9: therewith in rapture of the juice draw near to thy beloved spouse now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
text.10: with holy prayer i yoke thy longmaned pair of bays come hitherward thou holdest them in both thy hands.
text.11: the stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad thou thunderer hast rejoiced with pūṣan and thy spouse.
